title: Linux modinfo Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux modinfo command, which provides detailed information about kernel modules. Learn how to use modinfo to troubleshoot module issues and optimize system configuration.

meta.title: Linux modinfo Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux modinfo command, which provides detailed information about kernel modules. Learn how to use modinfo to troubleshoot module issues and optimize system configuration.
meta.keywords: Linux, modinfo, kernel modules, system configuration, troubleshooting, module information

verify.name: Verify the modinfo command version
verify.hint: The modinfo command version should be 2.6.32-504.16.2.el6 or a similar version.

verify.name: Verify the list of loaded kernel modules
verify.hint: The output of `modinfo -F filename -a` should include the ext4 module.

verify.name: Verify the error message for a non-existent module
verify.hint: The output of `sudo modprobe non_existent_module` should contain the message "non_existent_module not found".
